What You Need To Do For Your Business After Covid19 COVID 19 caught everybody by surprise and no one prepared through it properly. Government, Corporate, small businesses, and even working individuals Covid19 spared no one on his wake. Even know that the pandemic is not really over people are trying to find a way to cope up with the loss especially small businesses. Everyone is currently trying to recuperate a loss and finding a way to recover from all of this.

Mintzberg's 5 Ps of Strategy will help guide you on what to do with your business post-pandemic. Henry Mintzberg is a Canadian academic and author on business and management. Using Mintzberg's 5 Ps of Strategy as a guide here's a version you can apply post-pandemic.

  1. Positioning

In order to create a smart strategic decision, one must understand his/her position. It goes the same with your business, you must know your position in your environment. Who has your target market before this happened? What was your role before? And, who were your competitors? You have to understand all of this and understand where you are going. Does shutting down your operations and can you re-open your business without making any changes post-pandemic? Will you be able to recuperate your loss during the pandemic?

Many business owners are questioning the state of their business after the pandemic. Will they be able to reopen their business? However, some of the businesses are growing their business because they are in demand; like home delivery, home office tools, and gadgets. There are a lot of factors to consider and also have to consider your resilience. For now, take the necessary action to see where your business will be when the COVID pandemic is over.

  1. Planning a comeback!

A solid plan for comeback and reopening should be made in order to avoid any issue. Solid planning should be made directing you to the position you hope to be in. So the question is what you should do during this pandemic to go back being operational once it ends.

Things will only get harder if you don't have a solid plan to put in motion. So, make sure to create a plan that will help you after everything is over; Think long and hard of the steps you want to take, try to consider every scenario and every possibility.

  1. Perspective

A lot will have changed since the pandemic started. How you and your business sees the world and itself surely changes. It is important to consider the change in your perspective or how it evolved during this time. The questions like how did you respond when the pandemic started? How are you dealing with the current pandemic? All this will have an impact especially on how your employee and market see your organization after the pandemic and will determine what you can achieve post-pandemic.

  1. Projects!

The answer to all the questions above must point your goal to a set of projects for tackling your COVID-related issue. Prioritizing any projects that will future-proof your organization is a must. However, be aware that the projects you are starting will depend on the resources you currently have, start too many projects on limited resources will only cause delay and details of your plans.

  1. Preparedness

Lastly, you have to evaluate your business and yourself if you are ready to complete and tackle the projects you have a plan. There are differences between the readiness of yourself, your business, and your team so make sure to consider all the factors before starting your outline plan. There are a lot of factors that will determine the success of your post-COVID plan. You have to consider everything from resources to decision making down to a speed of execution. All these will determine who will succeed and who will fall flat.

The pandemic will no doubt change how we do business. COVID has had an unprecedented effect on the world and it is not even over yet. We must think, plan, and act on how we will be able to bounce back after everything is over.
